newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai baht firms late, interbank rate down.
newsitem.headline: Thai baht firms late, interbank rate down.

text.p: The Thai baht firmed in late quiet trade on Thursday as dollar buying calmed down following the Bank of Thailand's denial of a rumour that the central bank governor might quit, dealers said.
"The market was very quiet in the afternoon. The market was back to normal after the central bank's denial," one dealer at a foreign bank said.
The baht was quoted at 25.950/25.953 to the dollar near the close compared with 25.960/25.970 early and 25.948/25.953 at midday.
The Bank of Thailand fixed the mid-rate at 25.93 per dollar against 25.94 on Wednesday.
The dealer said the dollar was bid heavily in the morning on market talk that BOT governor Rerngchai Marakanond would resign.
A senior central bank official later categorically denied the rumour to Reuters.

Thai Finance Minister Amnuay Viravan also said that he saw no reason for Rerngchai to resign over a government decision to suspend his deputy who handled a bungled court case against executives of Bangkok Bank of Commerce Plc.
